intro: Liebigia elongata, commonly known as the slender liebigia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to red. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a fuzzy texture. Liebigia elongata is typically found in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and forest edges.
